Name: Figurine of a hippopotamus
Description: This figurine in alabaster, which was acquired in the art trade, but of which the provenance is not known, represents a hippopotamus on a socle. The work is very basic: the different details of the head and of the body of the animal are difficult to distinguish. It is probably a figurine which remained unfinished; the fact that the muzzle of the hippopotamus and the socle still form a whole is a revealing element. The piece dates from the Middle Kingdom.
